column1: Certain types of cancer treatments can cause women to have early menopause.
Early menopause can cause symptoms such as hot flashes and vaginal dryness.
Your health care provider can help you find treatments for these symptoms.
Treatments That can Cause Early Menopause
Cancer treatments that can cause early menopause include: - Surgery.
Some types of chemo can damage your ovaries and cause early menopause.
These treatments used to treat breast and uterine cancers can often cause early menopause.
Ask your provider if your cancer treatment may cause early menopause.
Many treatments can help ease the symptoms of early menopause.
In some cases, your provider may prescribe female hormones to help with hot flashes and other symptoms.
Even if you cannot take hormone therapy, you may be able to use small amounts of estrogen in or around your vagina to help with dryness.
Some women take medicines to help reduce bone loss after menopause.
